newsitem.title: USA: Texas inmate attempts suicide before execution.
newsitem.headline: Texas inmate attempts suicide before execution.

text.p: A Texas death row inmate attempted to kill himself by slashing his throat and a wrist with the blade of a disposable razor on Tuesday, one day before his scheduled execution, a prison spokesman said.

David Lee Herman, a former stockbroker convicted of the 1989 shooting death of a topless nightclub worker, was rushed to Huntsville Memorial Hospital after cutting his throat in two places and slitting his right wrist, the spokesman said.
Herman, 39, told prison officials he broke a razor apart to get the blade out, then flushed it down a toilet in his death row cell after cutting himself shortly before dawn.
"He told the warden that he had been planning this for some time and that he was doing it to take the attention away from himself," prison spokesman Larry Fitzgerald said.

After he was treated, Herman was taken back to death row and placed in an isolation cell to begin his death watch, a routine that includes around-the-clock observation by prison guards during the days leading up to an execution.

He was convicted of murder in the December 1989 shooting of Jennifer Burns, 21, during a robbery of the Lace topless nightclub in Arlington, Texas, where he had worked as a manager two years earlier. After forcing Burns and two coworkers into the club's office, Herman stole $20,000 from a safe and shot all three. The other two survived the attack, prosecutors said.
Herman is scheduled to be executed by lethal injection shortly after 7 p.m. EST (midnight GMT) on Wednesday at the state prison at Huntsville, about 45 miles (75km) north of Houston.
Prison officials said they could not recall another attempted suicide by a death row inmate in the days leading up to an execution.
